<DOMAIN>INFORMATION-TECHNOLOGY</DOMAIN>
<RESUME_START>
CORPORATE PROJECT MANAGER
Career Overview
Seasoned project manager driven to achieve results through strategic planning and professional relationship
building. Success in developing beneficial alliances between leaders to effectively drive growth and achieve
goals.
Dedicated to building strong teams within an organization through motivation and strong development.
Effective in fostering collaboration and consultative relationships with senior management and across
traditional boundaries; highlighting inflection points of technology decisions.
Technical leader with broad experience, brings focus on "big picture" business impacts of technology
projects: real costs, practical benefits, risks and contingencies.
Adaptable - skilled at supporting individuals, building systems, handling problems; as well as managing
teams, training, developing strategies, policies and processes.
Qualifications
Strategic Planning / Visioning & Tactical Execution
Manpower Planning & Scheduling SDLC Methodology/ Problem & Change
Software & Application Lifecycle Management Management SLA Authoring & Resource Allocation
Expense Budgeting & Forecasting Team-Building & Front-Line Leadership
Technology Upgrades & Training Led highly visible initiatives to develop, define and manage the execution of several ground up IT infrastructure and application integrations through corporate acquisitions and divestitures while successfully balancing resources, timelines and budgets.
Experience in complete Project Management Life cycle including Planning, Execution, Monitor & Control and closure.
Document business performance expectations, benchmark standards and develop guidelines.
Interfaced with key stakeholders and project team members to prioritize requirements and information technology needs.
Successfully lead learning enhancement classes to improve sales knowledge and people skills for workplace success and advancement.
Developed materials to successfully train associates.
Provide oversight of yearly and monthly budget planning activities providing forecasting and day-to- day expense management keeping projects under budget and proper tracking of expenses.
Direct all information technology and network system deployment and maintenance including all IT infrastructure, wireless communications, PC systems, local networks and mobile environment.
Assessing and recommending technology systems solutions based on operational needs while ensuring compliance with corporate standards.
Interfaced with outside vendors to source materials.

WORK EXPERIENCE


01/2014 to 01/2016
Corporate Project Manager
Company Name
Manage direct reports supporting multiple locations with annual revenues of $2M. Accountable for the
strategic direction, implementation, support, and development of all business applications, Enterprise
Resource Planning (ERP), Facilities Management, Financials, Forecasting and Procurement.
Established change management and help desk solutions and policies.
Developed new process design workflow to ensure on-time delivery of all solutions and within budget
leading to increase in monthly productivity by 20%.
Centralized disparate support documentation for all business applications and architecture.
Developed corporate process and tools for opportunities tracking, bid decision making and proposal
development. Developed training material for new products and technologies and delivered training classes to
associates.

01/2008 to 01/2014
Director of Information Technology and Systems
Company Name
Responsible for managing and executing business development activities for IT and other company business
lines.
Provided executive leadership over internal company-wide IT infrastructure.
Developed end user training material coordinating and conducting group and individual training
sessions based on staff and organizational learning needs. Introduced methods for tracking project management, workload planning and corporate business
performance metrics. Responsible for managing and executing business development activities for IT and other company
business lines. Installation of Gate and Locking systems (Saflok, Ving, Salto and Amano Mc Gann access control
systems) in various brands resorts interfacing with PMS systems.

01/2006 to 01/2008
Director of Information Technology and Systems
Company Name
Manage four hotels within REIT interfacing with both management and ownership to guide the hotel through
day-to-day operations.
Insure that the company's strategic technologies needs are the primary focus.
Provided first and second-tier technical support and knowledge on Windows server/desktop applications
and resort PMS/POS Systems. Provided operations management, including security, backup/recovery/disaster planning, off-hours staff
coverage.
Oversaw $1.4 M capital budget and hotel conversion.

EDUCATION AND TRAINING

Bachelor of Science :
Computers and Information Technology
UNIVERSITY OF PHOENIX
— City , State
Computers and Information Technology
Associates of Arts :
Finance and Business Administration
LAKE SUMTER COMMUNITY COLLEGE
— City , State
Finance and Business Administration
ITIL Foundation Course
Microsoft Certified Professional (MCP), CompTia A+, CompTia N+

SKILLS

A+, acquisitions, backup, budget planning, Budgeting, budgets, budget, business development, change management, conversion, decision making, delivery, direction, disaster planning, documentation, ERP, Enterprise
Resource Planning, Facilities Management, Financials, focus, Forecasting, help desk, information technology, ITIL, Leadership, Team — Building , managing, materials, access, Microsoft Certified Professional, MCP, network, networks, operations management, organizational, PC systems, people skills, policies, POS, process design, Procurement, Project Management, proposal
development, sales, Scheduling, SDLC, SLA, strategic, Strategic Planning, technical support, user training, training material, Upgrades, Windows server, workflow
<RESUME_END>

<JD_START>
Job Title: Data Strategy Program Manager, VP

Location: Plano, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  

The Chief Administrative Office (CAO) Chief Data & Analytics Office (CDAO) is responsible for the overall data strategy, analytics, reporting, and governance across the firm's CAO functions. This function supports groups such as Global Supplier Services, Global Security, Global Real Estate, Amenity Services, Document & Business Solutions, and CAO Strategic Initiatives. Our team’s mission is to help our organization manage its data assets and find the best solutions to surface insights from our data in an effort to drive business goals & initiatives, enhance analytics, and streamline reporting. In doing so, we look for improvements ranging from establishing quality data repositories to designing cutting edge analytic insights utilizing the latest data visualization and machine learning tools.

CAO’s Data Strategy Program is responsible for outlining and executing a plan to manage its data more strategically, building a data ecosystem in the public cloud that enables data-driven decision making, fosters innovation and collaboration, and ensures data quality, integrity, and security through proper governance and controls. The Data Strategy Program is a cross-functional program bringing together stakeholders and contributors across Data Governance, Technology, and Business groups to drive progress.

We are seeking a Data Strategy Program Manager to lead and oversee the fulfillment of objectives related to the Data Strategy Program, including oversight of program governance, program metrics and reporting, communications, initiative inventories, and business case development. The Data Strategy Program Manager will facilitate program outputs, including related whitepapers, a playbook of repeatable processes, and data product projects. The ideal candidate will have strong communication and project management skills and be comfortable working with a mix of technical and non-technical stakeholders. They will have experience in either program or product management and may have experience building and/or leading data strategy or data governance programs focusing on such principles as data risk management, data quality, or data product management.

The Data Strategy Program Manager will report directly to the Data Strategy team lead within the CAO CDAO but have additional accountability to the Data Governance team within the CAO CDAO. They will also participate in firmwide forums to receive and present guidance on governance and technology to drive a cohesive direction in CAO aligned to firmwide standards.

The successful candidate will be viewed as a subject matter expert for CAO’s Data Strategy Program, and will be relied upon to drive the strategy and vision of the program while facilitating execution of key deliverables.

Job Responsibilities

Develop and implement a comprehensive program roadmap that aligns with our organization’s overall objectives, including a focus on advanced analyticsGather and maintain a list business priorities and related initiatives, and develop and manage ongoing prioritization for Data Strategy initiativesManagement of whitepapers related to CAO’s Data Strategy in coordination with the Data Governance and CAO Technology teamsManagement of the CAO Data Strategy Playbook in coordination with the Data Governance and CAO Technology teams, outlining repeatable processes for continued program successEnsure seamless integration of data initiatives into existing processes, practices, and technology infrastructurePerform Project Management related to Data Strategy initiatives, ensuring stakeholder engagement and alignment, status updates, and issue escalationFacilitate updates and alignment with the CAO Data Governance CouncilDesign program success measures and metrics aligned to organizational goals, and communicate progress and related reporting to senior executivesCommunicate and coordinate effectively with various business groups and corporate functions to adhere CAO’s Data Strategy to firmwide standardsDirectly support execution of the Data Strategy Program being performed by Data Governance and CAO Technology partnersOther general ongoing program management and communications responsibilities as they relate to the Data StrategyEnhance the above with a focus on continuous improvementExecution of the above with an emphasis on accuracy and timeliness of meeting deliverables on prescribed timetables / calendars 

Required Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills

7+ years of relevant industry knowledge, ideally coupled with consulting, data governance, technology strategy, or technology product management experience3+ years coordinating projects, programs, and/or products across multiple teams/constituentsExperience leading or managing programs related to data platforms, data products, data governance, and/or data strategies strongly preferredExcellent written and verbal communication skills with an ability to summarize technical concepts to business stakeholders and translate business needs to technical tasksExcellent organizational, multitasking, and prioritization skills with an ability to coordinate and delegate across functional groupsFamiliarity with both Agile and Waterfall project management methodologiesGeneral understanding of data systems, data structures, and data analysis including artificial intelligence a plusInterpersonal and relationship-building skills – with an ability to influenceMust be comfortable speaking to senior management and presenting ideasAbility to run meetings across diverse functions, locations, and businessesBachelor’s degree required, technical or advanced degree a plus

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
